awd_titl_txt: Cylindrical Algebraic Decomposition and Quantifier          Elimination
awd_abstract_narration: This project continues investigation of the cylindrical algebraic  decomposition (CAD) technique.  This technique, developed in 1975  for quantifier elimination in the elementary theory of real-  closed fields, has been continually improved in the last twenty  years.  A vast number of mathematical problems can be expressed  in this theory and, potentially, solved via quantifier  elimination.  CAD has many applications, including control  engineering, connectivity and path finding problems.    Major improvements are also being made to the algebraic  algorithms needed for CAD, including polynomial resultants and  greatest common divisors, polynomial factorization, polynomial  root isolation and refinement, and computations with algebraic  numbers.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
